summary: This document is an email chain from March 2, 2020, discussing a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. An FBI Victim Specialist from the New York Field Office is requesting assistance from a contact (likely a legal or support professional) to provide therapy referrals for the victim and informs them about the victim's eligibility for New York State Crime Victim Compensation.

persons.name: FBI Victim Specialist New York Field Office
persons.context: The author of the initial email, requesting assistance for an Epstein victim with therapy referrals and informing about compensation eligibility.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Victim Assistance
events.description: An FBI Victim Specialist emails a contact to request assistance in providing therapy referrals for an Epstein victim and informs them about the victim's eligibility for New York State Crime Victim Compensation.
personsInvolved: FBI Victim Specialist New York Field Office

events.title: Meeting with Victim
events.description: The email recipient previously met with the victim in the fall of 2019, likely at a law firm.

events.title: Victim Meeting in LA
events.description: The victim was in Los Angeles the prior week and met with an unspecified individual.

keyFacts: An FBI Victim Specialist was actively assisting an Epstein victim with obtaining therapy referrals and accessing victim compensation as of March 2020.
The victim had previously met with the email recipient in the fall of 2019, and more recently in Los Angeles.
The victim is identified as eligible for compensation through the New York State Office of Victim Services (OVS).
The document shows ongoing post-investigation support for victims following Epstein's death.
